definition: vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

sentences.english: Upon entering the construction, visitors have reported feeling dizzy and disorientated.
sentences.chinese: 據進入房間的參觀者說，在裏面感覺眩暈和神志不清。

sentences.english: Riding on merry-go-round makes me feel dizzy.
Giddiness ruins up one's mind while attack .
sentences.chinese: 眩暈遺址之一的心靈，而攻擊。

sentences.english: That I would never get dizzy no matter how much I head bang.
sentences.chinese: 不管我甩頭多少次都不會覺得眩暈。

sentences.english: Swimmy happening, often still concern with the change of blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 眩暈的發生，還常與血壓的改變有關。

sentences.english: Fatigue is normal, and so is dizziness when you get up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 疲勞是正常的，當你起的很迅速的時候還會感到眩暈。

sentences.english: Objective To assess the curative effect of Phenergan(Promethazine Hydrochloride injection) patients with Vertigo.
sentences.chinese: 目的評價非那根治療眩暈症的療效。

sentences.english: They could also have enlarged lymph nodes, lethargy and vertigo.
sentences.chinese: 他們還可能有淋巴結腫大，嗜睡和眩暈等症狀。

sentences.english: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) is the most frequent vestibular disorder.
sentences.chinese: 良性陣發性體位性眩暈是最常見的前庭病症。

sentences.english: Spasm of the small labyrinthine vessels can give rise to vertigo and hearing loss.
sentences.chinese: 小迷路血管痙攣能引起眩暈和聽力喪失。

sentences.english: Attackers who do, will be subjected to the disorienting effects of the light.
sentences.chinese: 仍繼續靠近船隻的襲擊者，將遭到激光的眩暈效果。

sentences.english: A fear of heights, the medical word used for this is vertigo.
sentences.chinese: 恐高，醫學術語稱之爲眩暈。

sentences.english: There were no symptoms or signs of vertigo on head-turning maneuvers.
sentences.chinese: 在轉頭動作時沒有眩暈的症狀和體徵。

sentences.english: Thrown fruit can now proc Daze on a target riding a unicycle.
sentences.chinese: 向騎單輪車的玩家扔水果現在可以眩暈目標了。

sentences.english: She was dazed by a blow on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她頭上捱了一擊，使她感到眩暈。

sentences.english: There are many things that as a stranger initially threw me for a loop.
sentences.chinese: 最初，有很多事讓我這個初來乍到的異鄉人眩暈。

definition: nearing death/on the point of demise/approaching extinction
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
